section.title: How To - Use the Keyman Setup Bootstrapper
section.para: The Keyman installation bootstrapper is a self-extracting executable file that contains a Windows Installer technology MSI file, and optionally keyboards.

listitem.para: Checks the system before starting the installation to ensure that all prerequisites are met, and optionally downloads and installs the prerequisites.
Optionally checks online for an updated version of Keyman before installing.
Starts the Keyman Windows Installer MSI package.
Starts Keyman after the install completes.

section.para: The following command line parameters are supported in the bootstrapper:

listitem.para: -c — Continue setup after Windows restarts (this parameter is not normally required)
-o — Do not check online for updates or prerequisites (useful with -s)
-x <extractpath> — Extract all the files from the self-extracting executable to the path extractpath and exit the bootstrapper.
